intro: Doronicum columnae, commonly known as the columnar leopard's bane, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and cylindrical stems. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Doronicum columnae thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
